Package controller

Class AddAppointmentController

java.lang.Object
controller.AddAppointmentController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class AddAppointmentController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
This is an FXML Controller class which provides functionality to the Add Appointment screen (the Add Appointment FXML file).

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    private javafx.scene.control.Button
    addAppointmentButton
    The button that saves the user-input details as a new appointment record; it also brings the user back to the Appointments Table screen.
    private javafx.scene.control.Label
    addAppointmentLabel
    This is the header of the Add Appointment page - it reads "ADD APPOINTMENT".
    private javafx.scene.control.ComboBox<Contacts>
    apptContactComboBox
    A combo box (drop-down menu) used to select the contact that will be involved in this new appointment.
    private javafx.scene.control.ComboBox<Customers>
    apptCustomerComboBox
    A combo box (drop-down menu) used to select the customer that this new appointment is for.
    private javafx.scene.control.TextField
    apptDescriptionTextField
    This is the text field where the user inputs the description for the new appointment they wish to create.
    private javafx.scene.control.TextField
    apptEndTimeTextField
    This is the text field where the user inputs the end time for the new appointment they wish to create.
    private javafx.scene.control.TextField
    apptIdTextField
    This is the text field where the user would input an appointment ID for the new appointment they are creating; however, because the appointment IDs are currently auto-generated by the database, this text field is disabled and users cannot input anything into it.
    private javafx.scene.control.TextField
    apptLocationTextField
    This is the text field where the user inputs the location for the new appointment they wish to create.
    private javafx.scene.control.DatePicker
    apptStartDateDatePicker
    This is the Date Picker where the user inputs the start date for the new appointment they wish to create.
    private javafx.scene.control.TextField
    apptStartTimeTextField
    This is the text field where the user inputs the start time for the new appointment they wish to create.
    private javafx.scene.control.TextField
    apptTitleTextField
    This is the text field where the user inputs the title for the new appointment they wish to create.
    private javafx.scene.control.TextField
    apptTypeTextField
    This is the text field where the user inputs the type for the new appointment they wish to create.
    private javafx.scene.control.ComboBox<Users>
    apptUserComboBox
    A combo box (drop-down menu) used to select the user that is in charge of this new appointment.
    private javafx.scene.control.Button
    backButton
    Brings the user back to the Appointments Table screen (if the user clicks the button) without creating a new appointment.
    private javafx.scene.control.Label
    contactLabel
    This is the header text that precedes the combo box used to select the contact that will be involved in this new appointment.
    private javafx.scene.control.Label
    customerLabel
    This is the header text that precedes the combo box used to select the customer that the new appointment is for.
    private javafx.scene.control.Label
    descriptionLabel
    This is the header text that precedes the appointment description text field.
    private javafx.scene.control.RadioButton
    endDateDifferentNO_RadioButton
    A radio button marked "No"; if the user selects this, they are indicating that the appointment does not extend into the next day (meaning that the appointment ends on the same date that it started).
    private javafx.scene.control.ToggleGroup
    endDateDifferentTG
    The toggle group consisting of the endDateDifferentYES_RadioButton and the endDateDifferentNO_RadioButton; putting these two radio buttons into the same toggle group ensures that only one of them can be selected at a time.
    private javafx.scene.control.RadioButton
    endDateDifferentYES_RadioButton
    A radio button marked "Yes"; if the user selects this, they are indicating that the appointment does indeed extend into the next day.
    private javafx.scene.control.Label
    endDateQuestionLabel
    This is the label wherein the text asks the user whether or not the new appointment extends into the next day.
    private javafx.scene.control.Label
    endTimeLabel
    This is the header text that precedes the appointment end time text field.
    private javafx.scene.control.Label
    identificationNumberLabel
    This is the header text that precedes the appointment ID text field.
    private boolean
    localLanguageIsFrench
    Denotes whether the local language is French or a different language.
    private javafx.scene.control.Label
    locationLabel
    This is the header text that precedes the appointment location text field.
    (package private) DataHolder
    methodsLibrary
    An instantiation of the DataHolder class; this is necessary in order to call the methods that allow the application to switch to a different scene, as those methods cannot be static (and thus, an instance of the class is required in order to call those methods).
    private javafx.scene.control.Button
    signOutButton
    Brings the user back to the Login Screen (if the user clicks the button) without creating a new appointment.
    private javafx.scene.control.Label
    startDateLabel
    This is the header text that precedes the Date Picker that is used to indicate the new appointment's start date.
    private javafx.scene.control.Label
    startTimeLabel
    This is the header text that precedes the appointment start time text field.
    private javafx.scene.control.Label
    titleLabel
    This is the header text that precedes the appointment title text field.
    private javafx.scene.control.Label
    typeLabel
    This is the header text that precedes the appointment type text field.
    private javafx.scene.control.Label
    userInChargeLabel
    This is the header text that precedes the combo box used to select the user that is in charge of this new appointment.

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle rb)
    Initializes the controller class.
    private void
    onActionAddAppointment(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
    This method is called when the user clicks the "Add Appointment" button at the bottom of the Add Appointment screen; it saves the user-input details as a new appointment record (in the database's Appointments table), and also brings the user back to the Appointments Table screen.
    private void
    onActionDisplayAppointmentsTable(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
    This method gets called whenever the "Back" button on the Add Appointments screen is clicked by the user; first, a confirmation dialog box is output to the user (asking the user if they are sure they want to leave the "Add Appointment" screen without saving their input); if they click "OK", this method switches the visible screen back to the "Appointments Table" screen.
    private void
    onActionDisplayLoginScreen(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
    This method gets called whenever the "Sign out" button on the Add Appointment screen is clicked by the user; it outputs a confirmation dialog box asking the user if they are sure they want to sign out, and if the user confirms, then this method switches the visible screen to be the Login Screen once again.
    private void
    translateScreenToFrench()
    This method is called if the user's local language is determined to be French; it translates all components on the Add Appointments screen to French.

    • localLanguageIsFrench

      private boolean localLanguageIsFrench
      Denotes whether the local language is French or a different language. If this variable is true, the application gets translated to French; otherwise (if this variable is false), the application remains in English.

    • methodsLibrary

      DataHolder methodsLibrary
      An instantiation of the DataHolder class; this is necessary in order to call the methods that allow the application to switch to a different scene, as those methods cannot be static (and thus, an instance of the class is required in order to call those methods).

  • Constructor Details

    • AddAppointmentController

      public AddAppointmentController()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle rb)
      Initializes the controller class. This method links an Observable List to each of the the three combo boxes on the Add Appointment screen (the customer combo box, the contact combo box, and the user combo box). These Observable Lists are what will be displayed in each combo box. Additionally, this method determines the ZoneId, Locale, and local language (based on the retrieved Locale) of the current user; using this information, this method decides whether or not to translate the Add Appointment screen to French.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable

    • translateScreenToFrench

      private void translateScreenToFrench()
      This method is called if the user's local language is determined to be French; it translates all components on the Add Appointments screen to French.

    • onActionAddAppointment

      private void onActionAddAppointment(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      This method is called when the user clicks the "Add Appointment" button at the bottom of the Add Appointment screen; it saves the user-input details as a new appointment record (in the database's Appointments table), and also brings the user back to the Appointments Table screen. However, before saving the new appointment, this method checks to make sure that all input is valid; if it is not, a descriptive error dialog box is output to the user that prompts them to edit that input (and also gives them pointers on what would be considered valid input). NOTE: The only input field that is allowed to remain empty is the "Description" field; that way, if a user needs to create a new appointment but isn't entirely sure yet about the specifics of that appointment, they are still able to create the appointment and can input the description at a later point in time.
      Parameters:
      event - The ActionEvent that occurred; in this case, the "Add Appointment" button was clicked.
      Throws:
      IOException - Thrown by the FXMLLoader's "load()" method (if an error occurs while loading the desired scene), which is used in the process of switching screens

    • onActionDisplayAppointmentsTable

      private void onActionDisplayAppointmentsTable(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      This method gets called whenever the "Back" button on the Add Appointments screen is clicked by the user; first, a confirmation dialog box is output to the user (asking the user if they are sure they want to leave the "Add Appointment" screen without saving their input); if they click "OK", this method switches the visible screen back to the "Appointments Table" screen.
      Parameters:
      event - The ActionEvent that occurred; in this case, the "Back" button was clicked.
      Throws:
      IOException - Thrown by the FXMLLoader's "load()" method (if an error occurs while loading the desired scene), which is used in the process of switching screens

    • onActionDisplayLoginScreen

      private void onActionDisplayLoginScreen(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      This method gets called whenever the "Sign out" button on the Add Appointment screen is clicked by the user; it outputs a confirmation dialog box asking the user if they are sure they want to sign out, and if the user confirms, then this method switches the visible screen to be the Login Screen once again.
      Parameters:
      event - The ActionEvent that occurred; in this case, the "Sign out" button was clicked.
      Throws:
      IOException - Thrown by the FXMLLoader's "load()" method (which is used in the process of switching screens); the exception is only thrown if an error occurs while loading the desired scene.
